question:
Find $\dfrac{\partial F}{\partial x},$ $\dfrac{\partial F}{\partial
y}$ and $dF$ for $F(x,y)=f(u(x,y),v(x,y))$, where $f(u,v)=\arctan \left(\dfrac{u}{v}\right),$ $%
u(x,y)=x\sin (y)$ and $v(x,y)=x\cos (y)$.

Let be the line $r: \dfrac {x-1} {3} = \dfrac {2-y} {2} = 3-z $ and the plane $\pi: x + 2y-z-2 = 0$. 
Choose the true statement:
answer1: The line $r$ belongs to the plane $\pi$
answer2: The line $r$ is parallel to the plane $\pi$, but outside it.
answer3: The point $A=(7, -2, 1)$ is the unique  intersection point of $r$ and $\pi$.
answer4: The line $r$ is perpendicular to the plane $\pi$.

question: The polar form of $z=-1-i$ is

$\dfrac{(3x +4x)(5x-x)}{(6x-7x)}$

Solve the following linear system of equations:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\
&-x &+ &3y &+ &2z &= &-12 \\ 
&x &- &z &+ &y &= &0
\end{cases}$$

Use the graphical method to solve the problem:

\[\begin{array}{ll}
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1} + 2x_{2}\\
\text{subject to} & x_{1}\leq 4\\
& 2x_{2}\leq 12\\
& 3x_{1}+2x_{2}\leq 18\\
& 3x_{1}+5x_{2}\leq 40\\
&  x_{1},x_{2}\geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]
answer1: All the points on the line segment connecting  $x_{1}=2 ,~x_{2}=6$ and $x_{1}=4 ,~x_{2}=3$ are optimal.

Solve the linear system
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
3x & - & y & - & z & = & 4 \\
x & + & 5y & + & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(x,\,x,\,-2x+1\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(\frac{5}{4},\,y,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: For $\alpha\in\mathbb{R}$, let $\displaystyle f_\alpha(x)=\frac{|x|^\alpha}{e^\frac{1}{x}}$. For what values of the parameter $\alpha$ can $f_\alpha$ be extended to a continuous function defined on $\mathbb{R}$?
answer1: There is no such values of $\alpha$.

question:
Consider the system of equations

$$\begin{cases}
60x_1-30x_2-20x_3  & = & -400  \\
-30x_1+180x_2-60x_3  & = & 400 \\
-20x_1-60x_2+150x_3  & = & 300 \\
\end{cases}$$
 
Will the Gauss-Seidel method solve the problem?
answer3: Only if the initial approximation is $(0,0,0)$.
answer4: Only on a limited set of initial approximations.

Consider the linear applications 

$\begin{array}{cccc}
F: & \mathbb{R}^3 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y, z) & \longrightarrow & (y, x-z)
\end{array}$
$\begin{array}{cccc}
G: & \mathbb{R}^2 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y) & \longrightarrow & (x+y, x-2y)
\end{array}$

Choose the right answer:
answer1: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)$ does not exist
answer2: $(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$and $(G\circ F)$ does not exist
answer3: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$
answer4: $(G\circ F)(y, x-z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)(x, y)=(x+y, x-2y)$

answer1: The point $M(2,1)$ is a relative minimizer.
answer2: The points $M(1,2)$ is a relative maximizer.
answer3: The point $M(2,1)$ is a relative maximizer.

\[
\begin{array}{lc|cccc}
&   & & \text{Retail} &\text{ outlet} \\
& & \text{K} & \text{L} & \text{M} & \text{N}\\
\hline
& \text{A} & 2 & 4 & 5 & 1 \\
\text{Plant} & \text{B} & 3 & 4 & 5 & 7 \\
& \text{C} & 4 & 5 & 7 & 4 \\
\end{array}
\]

Use the transportation simplex method to determine the best plan for how many units to send from each plant to the respective retail outlets each month, minimizing the total shipping cost. Use the minimum cost rule to obtain an initial basic feasible solution.

question: Two triangles are congruent if, from one to the other, they have:
answer1: A congruent side and both adjacent angles to that side also congruent.
answer4: Two congruent sides. And an angle which is also congruent.

A researcher studies the wind speed in a particular city. A sample of two hundred observations was recorded. The mean speed was calculated to be $10 m/s$ and the median speed was calculated to be $7 m/s$. Which of the following interpretations is correct?
answer1: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was less than or equal to $7 m/s$.
answer2: The most frequently occurring wind speed in the sample was $7 m/s$.
answer3: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was equal to $7 m/s$.
answer4: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was less than or equal to $10 m/s$.
